Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 奥さん
Entry.EnglishText: Missus

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ここ何日か、祭司様の お手伝いをしていた人たちの 様子がおかしかったんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: For some time now, those working for the priest have been acting strange.

Entry.JapaneseText: ウチの旦那も行ってたんだけどね、 普段は口だけは達者なあの人が、 話し掛けてもぼんやりしてて ろくに口もききゃしなかった。
Entry.EnglishText: My husband is one of them. Usually he is rather eloquent, but lately whenever I would try to talk to him, he would be absent-minded and unable to converse well.

Entry.JapaneseText: さっき祭司様と戻って来た時も ぼうっとしてたけど、 祭司様がひと言、言葉をかけると 正気に戻ったんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: He seemed to be in a stupor when he returned earlier with the priest too, but the priest uttered a single word to him and he returned to normal.

Entry.JapaneseText: やっぱり祭司様のお言葉は 身が引き締まるのかねぇ。
Entry.EnglishText: I suppose the priest's words really do have a strong influence over people, don't they?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>、この感じは……
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>, this sounds like...

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、ワルトゥに操られていた 人々の反応に似ている。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes, it's similar to the behavior of someone being controlled by Walto.

Entry.JapaneseText: 街の人たちも暗示を かけられてたのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you think the townspeople are under his influence too?

Entry.JapaneseText: 娘たちを港に運ぶために、 暗示をかけて手伝わせていたと 考えられるな。
Entry.EnglishText: One can assume that they are being controlled in order to help transport the captured girls to the harbor.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワルトゥの暗示にかかった者は その間の事を覚えていない。 手伝った者の記憶が残らないから、 娘を運んだ痕跡も残らない。
Entry.EnglishText: The people hypnotized won't remember what they've done during that time. Since anyone who were to help with moving the girls would have no memories of it, it can't be traced back to Walto.

Entry.JapaneseText: とりあえず、その旦那さんの 話を聞いてみようよ？
Entry.EnglishText: Well, why don't we see what her husband has to say?

Entry.JapaneseText: ご主人はどちらに いらっしゃいますか？
Entry.EnglishText: Where might your husband be at this time?

Entry.JapaneseText: ウチの人かい？ 二階にいるよ。 あの人に何か用かい？
Entry.EnglishText: My husband? He's upstairs. Do you need him for something?

Entry.JapaneseText: いえっ、祭司様のお手伝いって どんな事をしたのか知りたくて。
Entry.EnglishText: No, we would just like to know what kind of work he was doing for the priest.

Entry.JapaneseText: あたしも聞いたんだけど、 「神聖なお仕えだから 話す事はできない」の 一点張りなんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've tried asking him, but he said that he couldn't tell me because it was a “sacred task.”

Entry.JapaneseText: きっと何も話しちゃくれないと 思うけど、もしなんか聞いたら、 後でこっそり教えてちょうだいな。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't really think he will tell you anything either, but if by some chance he does, would you mind sharing it with me?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい。
Entry.EnglishText: Of course.

Entry.JapaneseText: ウチの人なら二階にいるよ。 でも、何も話してくれないと 思うけどねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: My husband's just on the floor above. I don't think you'll be able to talk to him, though...

Entry.JapaneseText: あたしも聞いたんだけど、 「神聖なお仕えだから 話す事はできない」の 一点張りなんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've tried asking him, but he said that he couldn't tell me because it was a “sacred task.”

Entry.JapaneseText: もしなんか聞いたら、 後でこっそり教えて ちょうだいな。
Entry.EnglishText: If you manage to get something out of him, can you please tell me about it?

Entry.JapaneseText: 祭司様の言葉？ ……<Cyan>とし<White>がどうとか言っていたね。
Entry.EnglishText: The priest's words? I believe he said something about <Cyan>bees<White>...

Entry.JapaneseText: ウチの旦那、何も 話さなかったでしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: See? You didn't manage to get anything out of him in the end.

Entry.JapaneseText: あの人ったら、何を してたのかしらねぇ？ 気になるわぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what he was doing...?

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの旦那なんか連れてって 役に立つのかしらねぇ……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if my husband would be useful to bring along...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたってブスねぇ……！
Entry.EnglishText: You're ugly...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの美的感覚で見たら ヒューマの身体なんて、みんな 気持ち悪くて耐えられないけど！
Entry.EnglishText: When you look at Huma with a Gajuma's sense of aesthetics, they all look so ugly I can't stand it!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんとか混乱は収まったけど、 大丈夫かねぇ……
Entry.EnglishText: We finally managed to solve that crisis, but... Is it going to be alright?

Entry.JapaneseText: また、そのうち、 ガジュマとかヒューマで もめそうで怖いのさ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm scared that Huma and Gajuma might start fighting again...

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだか地震でも来そうな 妙な音だねぇ……リフトに 影響が出なきゃいいけど……
Entry.EnglishText: What a strange sound, it sounds like something produced by an earthquake... I hope the lift is alright.

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダが沈んだっていうけど、 バビログラードは大丈夫かねぇ？
Entry.EnglishText: I heard Razilda got swallowed by the ocean... Is Babilograd going to be alright?

Entry.JapaneseText: 街のほうは標高が高いからいいけど、 港のほうが心配だわ……
Entry.EnglishText: The city's way above the mountains, but I'm worried about the harbor...

Entry.JapaneseText: 男は男でもウチの人は別だね。 家族だからね。
Entry.EnglishText: I can't speak to men aside from my husband. That's because he's family.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何が違うのか、よくわからないけれど 他の男の人と話そうとすると 体がこわばっちゃうのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't know if there's something wrong with me or anything, but my body stiffens up when men tries to talk to me.
A-A man!!!!

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律か……
Entry.EnglishText: Commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか……戒律のせいで しゃべれないんだったネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right... Can't speak because of the commandments.

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、男とは 話せないようだな……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that you can't talk to men because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律……ですね。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, the Commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか、戒律が あったんだったな……
Entry.EnglishText: Man... So we really can't talk because of the Commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、女と 話せないんだったわね……
Entry.EnglishText: Because of the commandments, you aren't allowed to talk to women...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No
